alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 2:36PM MDT until August 25 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following county, Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall creating excessive runoff over Canon Santo Domingo on the extreme southwestern portion of the Cerro Pelado wildfire burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 236 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause excessive runoff with abrupt and fast flows developing in arroyos and small canyons with minor flooding possible. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will continue to lead to a threat of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portions of BIA Road 89 and Santo Domingo Pueblo.
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the far southwestern part of the Cerro Pelado wildfire burn area.
